files.description: Project configuration defining the package, dependencies, console-script entry point, and tool settings for linting/testing.
User-facing documentation describing the standardized primary-source workflow, protocol elements (checklists + metadata), and CLI usage examples.
Package initializer exposing the library version and high-level public interfaces used by the CLI.
Complete Python CLI tool implementing protocol checklists, metadata validation, provenance flags, variant numbering, repository citation linking, and evaluation export commands.
Protocol definitions for standardized workflows including checklist items, decision rules, and machine-readable templates.
Metadata schema (JSON Schema + helpers) for primary-source records, citations, repository links, variants, and provenance flags with validation utilities.
Core logic for provenance flagging, audit-trail capture, variant numbering, and generating citation strings with repository link resolution.
Empirical evaluation scaffolding including survey instruments, audit-study sampling plans, metrics (citation accuracy, reproducibility, effort), and analysis-ready export formats.
One-page preregistration template and analysis-plan stub embedded for CLI export, aligned with the missionâ€™s evaluation design.
Canonical checklist content and protocol elements stored as data for customization and versioned reuse across projects.
End-to-end tests exercising core CLI commands (init, validate, flag, variant, cite, export-eval) to ensure functional workflows and correct outputs.
Unit tests covering metadata schema validation, provenance flag rules, variant numbering determinism, and repository citation link generation.

missionDescription: Design a focused implementation-and-evaluation plan for standardized primary-source workflows and lightweight tooling in the history of psychology. Specify the protocol elements (checklists, metadata schema), the minimal viable software/plugin features (provenance flags, variant numbering, repository citation linking), and an empirical evaluation design (surveys + audit studies) that will measure effects on citation accuracy, reproducibility, and researcher effort.
missionSuccessCriteria: Deliver a prioritized checklist of protocol components and a compact metadata schema (fields + controlled vocabularies) that cover edition/translation provenance, page/paragraph variants, and public-domain repository identifiers.

Produce a minimum viable feature list and technical requirements for lightweight tools/plugins that can automatically detect/flag provenance, variant numbers, and public-domain repository citations (including data formats and integration points).

Provide a detailed empirical evaluation plan: sampling strategy for journals/archives, audit study methodology, survey instruments (key questions/metrics), statistical comparison metrics for citation accuracy/reproducibility, and an estimated sample size and timeline.

Outline an adoption and validation roadmap with measurable milestones (pilot deployment, community endorsement process, and success metrics for increased citation accuracy and reduced researcher time).
